sub_topic: Determining the treewidth of a graph.
message_1:
What is the treewidth of the following graph?

    1---2---3
        |   |
        4---5
        |
        6

(Note: The treewidth of a graph is the minimum width of a tree decomposition of the graph. In other words, it is the smallest number k such that the graph can be decomposed into a tree whose nodes are sets of vertices, such that each set contains at most k+1 vertices and each edge of the graph is included in at least one set.)
